list_page_teaser: In 2019 there were over a dozen candidates in the 2020 Democratic Presidential Primary.  This gallery contains images of nine of these contenders.  Click to learn more!
description_html:
These images are from the book Visualizing Politicians' Personalities, 2019 Incumbents and Candidates. Find excerpts from the book in the stories on this site about Donald Trump, Joe Biden, Mike Pence, and Kamala.

Buy Visualizing Politicians' Personalities, 2019 Incumbents and Candidates today at amazon.com!

This gallery is a work in progress. Check back for updates in a few days.

image_list.title: Amy Klobuchar
image_list.subtitle_html: US Senator From Minnesota, Jan. 3, 2007 to Present
image_list.gallery_page_teaser: Amy Klobuchar's spiritual portrait shows she has very mild preferences, but is for the most part decisive, logical, and down-to-earth.  Click on the image to learn more!
image_list.explain_dom: The Green in this spiritual portrait represents Amy's dominant personality trait, her very slight tendency to be more logical than emotional.  In Extraverts, the dominant trait is directed outwardly, and spiritual portraits use a long vertical line to represent this, because it is the side of their personality that is most evident.  She demonstrated this trait when she chose to go to law school, which requires being able to think logically.  It's important to note this tendency is very slight, and Amy can be quite warm and personable when the situation calls for it.
image_list.explain_aux: The Yellow in this spiritual portrait represents Amy's auxiliary personality trait, her very slight tendency to be more realistic than idealistic.  In Extraverts, the auxiliary trait is directed inwardly, and spiritual portraits use a horizontal line to represent this.  It's important to note this preference is very slight, and Amy is very idealistic when it comes to America's founding principles.
image_list.story_intro_html: This image of the personality of Amy Klobuchar shows she is reasonable and down-to-e....
image_list.story_html:
THIS IMAGE OF THE PERSONALITY OF AMY KLOBUCHAR SHOWS she is reasonable and down-to-earth. The variety of colors shows her predominant quality is a tendency to be well-rounded and flexible.

For the whole story about Amy's spiritual portrait, buy a copy of the book Visualizing Politicians' Personalities, 2019 Incumbents and Candidates by Tom W. Hartung online today at amazon.com!

You can find excerpts from this book on this site in the stories for Joe Biden and Kamala Harris in the Democratic Presidential Candidates - 2020 gallery, and the stories for Donald Trump, Mike Pence, Mitch McConnell, and Nancy Pelosi in the Top Incumbents - 2017-present gallery.

The profile used to create this image is based on Amy's memoir The Senator Next Door, A Memoir From the Heartland.

image_list.title: Bernie Sanders
image_list.subtitle_html: US Senator From Vermont, Jan. 3, 2007 to Present
image_list.gallery_page_teaser: Bernie Sanders' spiritual portrait shows he has a very cold, deep, logical, and idealistic temperament.  Click on the image to learn more!
image_list.explain_dom: The Blue in this spiritual portrait represents Bernie's dominant personality trait, his idealism and hope for the future.  In Introverts, the dominant trait is directed inwardly, and spiritual portraits use a long horizontal line to represent this.  He exhibits this tendency in the policies he supports, such as Medicare for All, which are progressive and forward-looking.
image_list.explain_aux: The Green in this spiritual portrait represents Bernie's auxiliary personality trait, his objectivity and tendency to be more cold, logical, and rational rather than emotional.  In Introverts, the auxiliary trait is directed outwardly, and spiritual portraits use a vertical line to represent this, because it is more evident than the dominant function.  He exhibits this tendency in his proposed methods for paying for his idealistic programs, which involve raising taxes on the very rich, who are the ones who have the money to spare.
image_list.story_intro_html: This image of the personality of Bernie Sanders shows he is very serious, determined, idealistic, and somewhat wi....
image_list.story_html:
This story comes from the book Visualizing Politicians' Personalities, 2019 Incumbents and Candidates by Tom W. Hartung, © 2019, all rights reserved.

THE PRECEDING IMAGE OF THE PERSONALITY OF BERNIE SANDERS shows he is very serious, determined, idealistic, and somewhat withdrawn. The Blue and Green in this image show he has a strong tendency to make rational decisions based on his principles and convictions.

Bernie is someone who thinks outside the box, but he is not one to brainstorm ideas. Harry Jaffe’s book Why Bernie Sanders Matters makes it plain Bernie’s message has not changed much, if at all, since his days with the Liberty Union Party in the 1970s. In a nutshell, Bernie cares deeply about the working class.

Bernie fits in better with the more progressive Democrat party than the conservative Republican party, but he is truly an independent thinker — he has his own ideals. In his book Harry Jaffe quotes a speech Bernie gave announcing his re-election campaign in May, 1997. Bernie told the crowd he challenged a Republican president when he was wrong and a Democratic president when he was wrong ... a Democatrically-controlled Congress when they were wrong and a Republican-controlled Congress when they were wrong.... [p. 134].

Although Bernie cares about the working class — regular people, most everyone except the filthy rich — he is not really a people person. In his first unauthorized biography of the senator who wants to be president [p. xi] Jaffe writes Not many legislators fit in Sanders's sandbox. After sixteen years on the House and nine in the Senate, he has few friends in either body [p. 195].

BERNIE IS FOCUSED ON HIS MISSION and has no time for anything remotely resembling folderol. And although his idealistic vision is focused on the well-being of common, everyday people, his message is more logical than personal.

Anyone who cannot see the logic behind the solutions Bernie proposes should read his book Bernie Sanders, Guide to Political Revolution. Unlike the other candidates’ more autobiographical books, Bernie eschews talking about his past and gets straight to the point, identifying what is wrong with America and how he intends to fix it. It gives the reader insight into Bernie’s stance on the issues, but learning about his background — and realizing his message has not changed for about fifty years — requires supplemental reading.

Bernie’s Guide to Political Revolution contains eight chapters, each of them addressing one of his core issues. Starting off with chapters on Guaranteeing a Livable Wage and a Decent Life and Real Tax Reform, he proceeds to drill down into big problems such as health care, climate change and criminal justice reform, before closing with a chapter entitled Immigration Reform Now. Although anyone versed in current events should be familiar with these issues, and Bernie’s proposed solutions, the cold hard logic of what he says about them makes his stance compelling and convincing.

Bernie has big ideas and they make sense, but justifying, rationalizing, and destigmatizing his brand of democratic socialism — specifically describing how he plans to pay for all the free stuff without raising taxes — takes time. Then there are the super-rich people who are determined to do anything they can to prevent his election.

In the 2010s Bernie’s boldly populist and futuristic message is finally starting to gain traction. Certainly by now — after decades of relentlessly working to get his message out there — he has the name recognition needed to actually get elected. His spiritual portrait is enlightening because it shows that, although his proposals are all about people, they are in fact based more on reason than emotion.

THE PROFILE FOR THIS IMAGE IS BASED ON the books Why Bernie Sanders Matters by Harry Jaffe, 2015 and Bernie Sanders, Guide to Political Revolution by Bernie Sanders, 2017.

To learn more about Bernie and other contemporary politicians, buy Visualizing Politicians' Personalities, 2019 Incumbents and Candidates by Tom W. Hartung online today at amazon.com!

image_list.title: Cory Booker
image_list.subtitle_html: US Senator From New Jersey, Jan. 3, 2013 to Present
image_list.gallery_page_teaser: Cory Booker's spiritual portrait shows he is deep and idealistic, and motivated by his warmth and concern for others.  Click on the image to learn more!
image_list.explain_dom: The Blue in this spiritual portrait represents Cory's dominant personality trait, his moderate preference for ideas over facts.  In Extraverts, the dominant trait is directed outwardly, and spiritual portraits use a long vertical line to represent this, because it is the side of their personality that is most evident.  He demonstrates this trait in his ongoing pursuit of racial and social justice.
image_list.explain_aux: The Red in this spiritual portrait represents Cory's auxiliary personality trait, his preference to be warm and compassionate.  In Extraverts, the auxiliary trait is directed inwardly, and spiritual portraits use a horizontal line to represent this.  He demonstrates this trait in his support for studying the idea of paying African Americans reparations for slavery.
image_list.story_intro_html: This image of the personality of Cory Booker shows he has faith and is people-oriented. The Blue and Red in this image show his ....
image_list.story_html:
THIS IMAGE OF THE PERSONALITY OF CORY BOOKER shows he has faith and is people-oriented. The Blue and Red in this image show his predominant qualities are his religious and spiritual ideals, his ability to empathize with people, and his heart-felt desire to help others, especially those who are underprivileged.... [Continued in the book.]

FOR THE REST OF THE STORY about Cory Booker's spiritual portrait, buy a copy of the book Visualizing Politicians' Personalities, 2019 Incumbents and Candidates by Tom W. Hartung online today at amazon.com!

YOU CAN FIND EXCERPTS FROM THE BOOK on this site in the stories for Joe Biden and Kamala Harris in the Democratic Presidential Candidates - 2020 gallery, and the stories for Donald Trump, Mike Pence, Mitch McConnell, and Nancy Pelosi in the Top Incumbents - 2017-present gallery.

THE PROFILE USED TO CREATE THIS IMAGE is based on Cory's memoir United: Thoughts on Finding Common Ground and Advancing the Common Good.

image_list.title: Elizabeth Warren
image_list.subtitle_html: US Senator From Massachusetts, Jan. 3, 2013 to Present
image_list.gallery_page_teaser: Elizabeth Warren's spiritual portrait shows she has a very rational, decisive, cool temperament, and is motivated by her ideals.  Click on the image to learn more!
image_list.explain_dom: The Green in this spiritual portrait represents Elizabeth's dominant personality trait, her slight tendency to be more objective rather than subjective.  In Extraverts, the dominant trait is directed outwardly, and spiritual portraits use a long vertical line to represent this, because it is the side of their personality that is most evident.  She demonstrates this trait in her decision to work as a lawyer and legislator, professions requiring a firm grasp of logical thinking.  It's important to note this preference is slight, and Elizabeth has plenty of empathy, especially for people who are disadvantaged or have come upon hard times in some way.
image_list.explain_aux: The Blue in this spiritual portrait represents Elizabeth's auxiliary personality trait, her very slight tendency to be more idealistic rather than pragmatic.  In Extraverts, the auxiliary trait is directed inwardly, and spiritual portraits use a horizontal line to represent this.  She demonstrates this trait in the way she embraces progressive ideas, such as strengthening society's safety net.  It's important to note this preference is very slight, and Elizabeth can be quite pragmatic when the situation calls for it.
image_list.story_intro_html: This image of the personality of Elizabeth Warren shows she is rational and imag....
image_list.story_html:
This story comes from the book Visualizing Politicians' Personalities, 2019 Incumbents and Candidates by Tom W. Hartung, © 2019, all rights reserved.

THE PRECEDING IMAGE OF THE PERSONALITY OF ELIZABETH WARREN shows she is rational and imaginative. The Blue, Green, and Red in this image show her predominant qualities are a tendency to make decisions using both her head and her heart — but primarily using her head — and her underlying idealism, which drives her decisions.

In her book Elizabeth Warren, Her Fight, Her Work, Her Life, Antonia Felix writes that when Elizabeth was in the second grade, she knew she wanted to do something [p. 26] besides be just a wife and mother. Elizabeth’s mother Pauline increased pressure on her daughter to focus on a traditional feminine role until finally the friction came to a head one evening and the argument ended only when her mom slapper her hard across the face [p. 37].

Elizabeth ultimately pursued both family and career-oriented goals with relentless determination, and her efforts paid off. By 1976 she was married with two children — Amelia and Alex, and she had earned two degrees — a BS and a JD.

While a law student, Elizabeth became curious about the type of people who declared bankruptcy. Antonia Felix writes she began a phase of scholarly research on bankruptcy at UT [University of Texas at Austin], setting out to prove they [people who declared bankruptcy] were all a bunch of cheaters [pp. 82-83]. Elizabeth and her team went on to publish the results of their research in a book that started a national conversation about bankruptcy and shattered the stereotypes of bankruptcy filers as deadbeats [p. 84].

ELIZABETH’S BALANCED TEMPERAMENT IS WELL-SUITED for a field like bankruptcy law. Her tendency to be rational is very slight, and lead her to initially want to study the law and examine the statistics. But what she learned from her research brought her compassion to the fore. She genuinely cares about people — especially for otherwise innocent, average people in families who have had financial problems, often due to predatory lending practices.

Antonia Felix writes that Elizabeth’s work led her to change her party affiliation in 1996, leaving the Republican party and joining the Democratic party. Elizabeth’s ideals motivate her, and she came to feel the Republican party had sold out to business interests.

On the April 20, 2014 episode of ABC’s This Week Elizabeth told George Stephanopoulos that she had thought the Republican party was principled in its conservative approach to economics and to markets [p. 131], but learned differently. She went on to say the GOP really stood up for the big financial institutions when the big financial institutions are just hammering middle class American families [p. 132], so she switched.

After the Great Recession in the late 2000s, Elizabeth went on to create the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau. Chapter 6, entitled The Sheriff of Wall Street, in Antonia Felix’s book tells this story, and concludes by saying the bureau was Elizabeth’s highest achievement and it punched a hole in the rigged system that Elizabeth had been studying and warning the country about for decades [p. 174].

THE PROFILE FOR THIS IMAGE IS BASED ON the book Elizabeth Warren, Her Fight, Her Work, Her Life by Antonia Felix, 2018.

To learn more about Elizabeth and other contemporary politicians, buy Visualizing Politicians' Personalities, 2019 Incumbents and Candidates by Tom W. Hartung online today at amazon.com!

image_list.subtitle_html: 47th Vice President of the US, Jan. 20, 2009 to Jan. 20, 2017
image_list.gallery_page_teaser: Joe Biden's spiritual portrait shows he is is extremely outgoing, sociable, and loquacious, but well-balanced and adaptable in other respects.  Click on the image to learn more!
image_list.explain_dom: The Green in this spiritual portrait represents Joe Biden's dominant personality trait, Thinking: objectivity; rationality; cool-headedness; very slight/moderate/strong preference for logic/reason/objectivity over emotion/empathy/subjectivity; their very slight/moderate/strong preference for the logical/rational/objective over the emotional/personal/subjective.  In Extraverts, the dominant trait is directed outwardly, and spiritual portraits use a long vertical line to represent this, because it is the side of their personality that is most evident.  He/She demonstrates/exhibits this trait in their (note that is easier to find examples of decisions than perceptions!) ....
image_list.explain_dom_very_slight_preference: It's important to note this preference/tendency is very slight, and X can be quite _____ in some situations/when the situation calls for it.
image_list.explain_aux: The Yellow in this spiritual portrait represents Joe Biden's auxiliary personality trait, Sensing: pragmatism; pragmatic; practical; realism; realistic; outlook; openness to new experiences; very slight/moderate/strong preference for facts over ideas.  In Extraverts, the auxiliary trait is directed inwardly, and spiritual portraits use a horizontal line to represent this.  He/She demonstrates/exhibits this trait in their (note that is easier to find examples of decisions than perceptions!) ....
